Delusion.description: I have difficulty trusting others due to past experiences of being taken advantage of and betrayed, particularly by family members.
I feel the need to protect myself from being hurt by others, which leads to self-isolation and avoiding social interactions.
I believe that I am unlovable and destined to be alone, especially during depressive episodes.
I express significant frustration with my family members, including those struggling with alcoholism and those who take advantage of my generosity.
I avoid social interactions and isolate myself at home to prevent feelings of rage and disappointment.
I debate whether to reconnect with estranged individuals but fear repeating negative cycles of insincere apologies and manipulation.
I have a history of significant aggressive behavior and violence, which continues to influence my relationships and coping mechanisms.
I believe that I cannot rely on anyone, reinforcing my tendency to isolate and handle challenges alone.
